column4: is there an easy way to open ports on the default ubuntu firewall after install?
There is no default firewall on Ubuntu.
sorry, I didn't see your last reply
Is your ISP blocking inbound to port 80?
I see.  Sounds like your port forwarding is not working properly.
any idea why that would be?  it has worked properly in the past
Do you have a way to verify that external connections to your network on port 8080 are failing?
no, I don't have any way of verifying I can't connect, other than what other people have already told me
I just tested it with a free shell account, and it isn't working
Is the connection dropped and thus causing a long timeout, or it it closed with a tcp reset and you get disconnected right away?
I can't tell... I just get "permission denied"
probably the reset, because it happens almost instantaneously
